result.execSummary:
The defendant Douglas John Kagigebi was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Posses w/Intent-Fentanyl (<=10g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(dm)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
6 years initial confinement.   Concurrent to 20CF82 and 21CF46.   135 days credit.   DEF eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to 20CF82 and 21CF46.

superMiscConds.notes: Complete any counseling and programming deemed appropriate by agent, and follow through.

$518.00  If probation / supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Douglas John Kagigebi

records.addlTxt:
1:09 PM Defendant Douglas John Kagigebi in court, in custody.  Attorney Renee M Taber in court for Douglas John Kagigebi.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  State request court to amend Count 1, by removing language "Second and Subsequent Offense".  Court moves to Amend Count 1.   State recites agreement, All parties agree.   Court reviews the amended information, DEF enters NC plea to Count 1.  DEF advised of rights and penalties; DEF waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea to Amended Count 1 and finds DEF guilty to Amended Count 1.   Count 2 is dismissed and read in.    State makes statement prior to sentencing.  Attny Taber makes statement prior to sentencing.  DEF no comment.  Court has discussion with DEF, DEF responds.   Court to follow agreement.   

COURT:  11 years state prison.  6 years initial confinement.   Concurrent to 20CF82 and 21CF46.   135 days credit.   DEF eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program.  5 years extended supervision.   Conditions of extended Supervision.  Complete any counseling and programming deemed appropriate by agent, and follow through.   Court Costs, DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
11:19 AM Defendant Douglas John Kagigebi appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Renee M Taber appeared by video for Douglas John Kagigebi.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.   State indicates to proceed with preliminary hearing.  State calls witness,  Deputy Kevin Hagmann, sworn in by Clerk Torstenson.  State begins examination.  11:23 AM  Witness identified the DEF, court indicates the record will reflect.  State continues examination. 11:28 AM   State tenders witness.  11:28 AM  Cross-Examination by Attorney Taber. 11:29  AM Attny Taber no further questions.  11:29 AM  Witness excused.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.
Arraignment scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 1, 2022 at 11:15 am.

11:12 AM Defendant Douglas John Kagigebi appeared by video, in custody, from Sawyer County Jail., with Atty Renee Taber, appearing by video.   Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF indicates receipt of criminal complaint.  Atty Taber indicates if unsigned complaint is same as signed copy DEF received, no issues.  Atty Taber requests preliminary hearing, does not waive time limits.  Court verifies DOB and address of DEF. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint,  Discussion on scheduling.  DEF has no issue with Atty Taber appearing by zoom for the preliminary hearing.  Court addresses DEF on right to personal appearance.  DEF makes statement on civil case.  Atty Taber makes statement on civil case, indicates not appointed on that case, requesting case track along.  Court indicates civil case will track with this case.  Court sets Prelim for 7/1/22 at 11:15AM.
CASH BOND RETURNED FROM JAIL MARKED REFUSED AS DEFENDANT REFUSED TO SIGN BOND.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

11:08AM DEF Douglas Kagigebi in court, appearing by video from in custody in Sawyer County Jail, with Atty Stephanie Thomas-Schmidt (special appearance) appearing by video.  Kenneth Sortedahl appearing by video for the State of WI.    Court calls case and recites appearances.  DEF verifies DOB and address.  DEF does not qualify for public defender appointment.  Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation.  Atty Thomas-Schmidt argues bond.  Court sets bond.  Court sets initial appearance for 6/22/22 at 11:00AM.  

COURT:  CBS $25,000 ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843.
